citation.article-title: Phycicoccus cremeus sp. nov., isolated from forest soil, and emended description of the genus Phycicoccus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Phycicoccus Lee 2006
The characteristics of the genus are as described by Lee (2006) with the following modifications.
Cells are cocci or short rods.
The predominant fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The phospholipid pattern contains diphosphatidylglycerol and may contain phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylinositol.
The DNA G+C content is 70–74 mol% (Tm).
